page.title: 01Egton High Moor
page.content: Most of the area is high heather dominated moorland although a lower area is farmed in the depression f Bitter Beek and also were the moors drop sharply into Glaisdale in the north west. the valley sides have quite extensive commercial softwood plantations before giving way to predominantly sheep and cattle grazing in the valleys. There are fairly extensive hardwood areas along Butter Beck. The residents are farmers and there are only a very few farms in this block. The moors are used for sheep grazing and grouse shooting. Roads do traverse the block and so the area is visited by tourists as well as walkers. The block is in a National Park and has spectacular views over the surroundng moors and valleys.
